Cleveland.Ohio Savings Plaza: The Ohio Savings Plaza is a commercial high-rise building in Cleveland, Ohio. The building rises 253 feet (77 m) in Downtown Cleveland. It contains 17 floors, and was completed in 1969. The Ohio Savings Plaza currently stands as the 31st-tallest building in the city, tied in rank with the Penton Media Building and Ameritech Center. The architect who designed the building was George S. Ryder. Ohio Savings Plaza has an underground tunnel which can be accessed from within a janitor's closet and leads directly to a restroom in the Phoenix Coffee across the street.
